TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1504-1505
TEI.2.document_title: Henry W. Munson to Stephen F. Austin, 11-15-1826

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1504-1505

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Describing boundaries of Atascosito district.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*The *location_mentioned*Atascosito District*/location_mentioned* is bounded as follows viz. *location_mentioned*On the west by the Colony of San Felipe de Austin*/location_mentioned* *location_mentioned*on the north by the District of Nacogdoches*/location_mentioned*,*location_mentioned* on the east by the reserved lands on the Sabine*/location_mentioned*, *location_mentioned*on the south by the Gulf of Mexico including all Islands and Bays within three leagues of Sea Shore*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p*To *person_mentioned*Col. Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Sir Above is stated the limits of the *location_mentioned*Atascosito District*/location_mentioned* as it was agreed on at the meeting of the *person_mentioned*inhabitants */person_mentioned*here and as we suppose ought now to stand since the*location_mentioned* 20 leagues on the Sabine*/location_mentioned* here tofore reserved has been constituted a *location_mentioned*Colony*/location_mentioned*—if there be any error or defect in defining the limits you will alter or supply it in the translation—*/p* *p**location_mentioned*Atascosito District*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="11-15-1826">Nov. 15th 1826*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Henry W. Munson*/person_mentioned**/p* */div1*
